Harry Potter is a series of seven fantasy novels written by British author J. K. Rowling. The books chronicle the adventures 

of the eponymous adolescent wizard Harry Potter, together with Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger, his best friends. The 

central story arc concerns Harry's struggle against the evil wizard Lord Voldemort, who killed Harry's parents in his quest to 

conquer the wizarding world, after which he seeks to subjugate the Muggle (non-magical) world to his rule.

About J.K. Rowling

J.K. Rowling is a British novelist, famed for her fantasy series called Harry Potter.

She has written seven primary books and three supplementary ones as part of the Harry Potter series. She has also written 

several articles, and an adult-oriented novel called The Casual Vacancy.

Her writing is very detailed and engaging. It has been the focal point of her rags to riches story. It has also won her 

numerous awards and honorary degrees.

Rowling was born on July 31, 1965, in Yates, Gloucestershire in England. She earned her A Levels in English, German , and 

French, and then an arts degree in French and Classics from the University of Exeter. She taught English as a foreign 

language in Porto, Portugal. Rowling is also involved in several philanthropic causes. She is now married to her second 

husband, Neil Murray, and they have two kids.
